page.title: 09Travel
page.content: providing employemnt. It is hoped that work will begin soon on the rebuilding of St Mary's Church tower, which fell down in 1976. 70,000 pounds is needed for its restoration. The general opinion is that it is a costly operation, but must be afforded to preserve our heritage. A minority felt that the money raised should be given to the Third World. The gravestones at Bildeston Baptist Church have recently been re-sited and it was thought by the villagers to be a good idea. The area has become more attractive and it is easier to keep tidy. Wattisham. Although the people of Wattisham enjoy living in the friendly atmosphere a small village provides, they feel that their life is adversely affected by the presence of R.A.F.Wattisham.
